intro: Pavetta indica f. microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often with a fragrant scent. Its fruits are small berries that mature to a dark red color, containing several seeds. This variety is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
